lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We play Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Timmy the Tiger--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're so stupid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tonight, she delivers the Marishaler Report.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What anime is this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As you said, I am Marisha Ray.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a lit cigarette.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But, when I started digging, I discovered lies, deception, illegal campaign donations--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: --and coordination with foreign powers--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Impossible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If everyone will allow me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't do that here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What does ciassified mean? (laughing)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm very high.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let the farce continue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: High on the chain of command.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep going, keep going.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anyway if it pleases the table, I submit as evidence exhibit one, the phone call.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, what happened?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think you have to set it up more.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (hangup sound) (footsteps)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While combing through Chris Lockey's cast photos, I noticed something strange about one in particular.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What the fuck is going on?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (gasps and cries of alarm)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dun dun dun!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean that's...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A witch!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That could be a picture of anybody.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why is Liam's wallet filled with British pounds?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is this bit?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm a woman on a mission--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stop, stop, stop!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing happens in the studio without me knowing about it, O'Brien!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What the fuck are you people doing to me right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shortly after the wallet incident, I set up a series of hidden cameras in the back of the studio.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cameras?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like in the bathrooms?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure enough, late one night, they recorded a conversation between one Liam O'Brien and a gentleman, codename Sherlock.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is this going to be available on the podcast?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've since identified this man to be none other than Mark Hulmes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's ridiculous.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A man who was posed as our friend, but is he really? (whispered) Is he really? Roll the tape.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Sticky wizard, is it safe to talk?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They think it's hilarious.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Well, so after you win the D&D Beyond election, you remember your mission?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, won't that be confusing, though? Nobody knows what a stone is and what it weighs.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Do you really want me to cut you off?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sherlock, it's just, you really want D&D Beyond app to change all vests to waistcoats? All carts to lorries, all uniforms to kits? You want me to change every time it says counter clockwise to anti clockwise?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I want it all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but why?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: (laughs evilly) (soft electronic music)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But I'm running low on cash.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: I'll send you a few farthings.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What the hell is a farthing?

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Destroy Sam Riegel, win the presidency, and then do what I tell you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Goodbye.

lines.name: MARK
lines.text: Ah, ah, ah, I think you mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (soft electronic music) (soft electronic music) (soft electronic music)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rest my case.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that was impressive. Thorough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Legitimate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I haven't worked for three weeks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, over to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what's going on here, but you all will hear from my lawyers.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know anything about this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You'll get a chance to respond next week, but let's the people digest this bombshell information.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I have a lot to think about after that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Max, let's put this through the shredder.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know if Marisha should be wearing a wig or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's an example of one of their awesome prints right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? (exclaiming)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Their ongoing Kickstarter campaign can be found at critrole.com/eldritchfoundry, and has just one more week to go before it finishes, so check it out and be a part of it if you can.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now we're going to perform all of Canterbury Tales as part of the sponsorship promotion, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys made a 15 minute short film about it, didn't you? Experimental short video?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's on the internet. Like, that just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Automatically disqualified from all awards again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is why it's more surprising that that shit gets made.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can't help ourselves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next Monday, June 3rd, we have a very special one-off episode of Between the Sheets with our own lovely Ashley Johnson.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's out this Monday?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This Monday.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, how about it? Hey, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We also, I guess-- wow, we launched our official Instagram account. That happened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Finally we did it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, no you did not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We forgot!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was a beautiful moment of silence that I'll cherish forever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ball sack!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, Mighty Nein, what would you like to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we saying that it is the next morning now or are we going through the night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going through the night at this point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Through the night, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold on, I got to pick some spells for the next day now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, I'm doing my spell checks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Correct me if I'm wrong, but you clerics did all the cleric-ing, the before bed cleric-ing that you do, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't found a place necessarily to rest yet, if I recall you were in the process, or did you set up a dome?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We were just going to do the dome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that there was just the end of the fight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we were terrified.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, well, let's pick up from there, then.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I smear some bat shit away off of my hands and look around and, do we-- are we going any further after that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're bedding here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think they got stronger in the dark,

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what it seems.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should definitely hide at night and travel during the day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can maybe get a little bit of extra travel with some Daylight spells, but other than that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's an hour of that, so--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we'll want to maybe get the last of that out maybe or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think that was correct. I think you guys did bed down in the dome to sleep that night.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, we may have.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (rewinding sounds)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's get in the dome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stop talking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good night, Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good night, Beau.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good night, Ned.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good night, Fjord.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good night, Ned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is anyone keeping watch or are you all sleeping for the night?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take the first watch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, do you need some company? Are you okay?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know what the best way for us all to get a decent rest is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I already clicked that I got a long rest, but you know what I'm going to take first watch with you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, yeah, it would be nice to have some company.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go to sleep everyone. It's okay. We'll keep watch.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Take care.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Those things were fucking scary as fuck.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I'm not scared of a lot of things, but those things freaked me out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Had you ever seen them before here?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And they seemed so sad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know they--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He like, he looked like if he could have cried, he would have been crying.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, like it was a person once or something, I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They were forced to, maybe? Also, though, they were really scary, so I don't feel that sorry for them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't like it. This is a weird place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You grew up here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well I, I did, but not quite in an area like this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not the Barbed Fields.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, no, this is-- I've heard about them, but this is-- I'm glad that this isn't, that I didn't grow up here in this place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you nervous?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I'm nervous. I just don't know what we're walking into, you know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I know that, you know, he seemed to respect you or know about you, or like the things that you've done, you know?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who knows, maybe when you lost your memory you were like, like a rock star or something.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, maybe I performed and I--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, maybe there was like a bar or something and you performed every night and everybody came to see you and then you disappeared and everyone was like aw, where's that Yasha chick? She's so good. The Orphan Maker.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I wonder what instrument I played?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely like a harp.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I think I could probably--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But like a really like hardcore harp.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think I'm just mostly nervous because I I feel like he knows-- it's weird when you feel like someone knows something about you that you don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And I hope it's just that I was a rock star.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe he's not a horrible guy and you can find out what he knows.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll just pretend that I was a harp star.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And if it was something bad, just let me know if you want to forget it again because I think we can make you forget.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At least for a while.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, that's not a bad idea. Thank you, Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe not the best way to deal with it, but...

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, we're doing a good job.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you make perception checks for me, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A natural 20!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, a natural 19!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very nice.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We were like this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing bad will happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's large and lumbering and you feel just a light (rumbling footsteps).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nothing can get through here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the shaping of a lumbering and shifting with its odd multi-impacting gait and you watch it move up towards one of the strange curving spires of stone that seem to be hooking up about 60 or 70 feet in the air and this entity goes up towards it and (impact sound) butts against it and begins scratching its shoulders and back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How high did he go on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 25 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha, that thing is huge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see the two sets of arms at his forearms, kind of gorilla like, moving, and it's just scraping its shoulder back against the spire, like a large bear trying to scratch an itch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh he just needs a pet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, he's a little scratchy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could go up and scratch his little back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (satisfied snorting)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get it good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks past.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can he see us in here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but he can hear us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (rumbling footsteps) Then it just slowly moves a little further and further away until the darkness takes it entirely and it's no longer visible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my God, what if we run into one of those while we're traveling through here?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But maybe we can, maybe we won't see him again, and if we do maybe we can just offer some scritches.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just climb up and give him some scritches.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's no trifle creature.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whose idea was it to come this way? (scoffs) (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next watch, anybody?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're welcome to make a perception check, if you'd like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 10, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking 10.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you know you're dressed like a tiger?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hadn't occurred to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically not a tiger.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably a liger.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mmm. Backwards hands.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take notice the opaque dark colored domes seem to be enough to keep the eyes of such creatures at bay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How can it be chirping when it's screeching?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Third and final watch anybody?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By himself. Go ahead and roll a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beyond that, no other major issues, you guys come to consciousness, breakfast is awaiting you at the hands of Caduceus Clay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to burn a spell for that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus, why didn't you wake me up? I would have done the last watch with you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I didn't-- no idea, and I figured everyone needed some sleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everything hurts.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It'd been a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How was it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Brief before this, but it was worth while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks for making food.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, no problem. Sorry it's a little basic, but.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We should get moving as quickly as we can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Use up all the daylight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus, does it look like that storm front's heading our way?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it look like that storm front is heading our way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is heading across the entire fields at an angle. So it is making its way towards not you specifically, but it is going to be taking most of the sky above you shortly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we going to be fighting against it or are we, are we going to be-- is it traveling the same direction we that we are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks like it's going to be against you, so it will pass quicker it seems.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just a little rain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we still-- is the landscape still almost like a flat, like a salt flat type of thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You had a faint bit of rain day before, it caused some of it to mud and muck up, but it was very, very minor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Still scattered with these giant--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Spires, these rock formations that are made of stone that is not natural to this, to the rest of the plains around you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And it's like flat as the eye can see right? We're not on any sort of a slow ravine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The terrain does shift and move and there are craters, there are a large chasms and holes in here that appear to, some of them, through a blasted force that eventually just fell back in, some, the earth just is torn open in places.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like Beetlejuice limbo without the red filter is the vibe I'm getting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cool, all right, I'm in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm thinking sort of like flash flood.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It might get muddy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's probably going to get muddy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if it's going to be like the playa where it gets like--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's going to suck!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's mount up!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Difficult terrain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking around, your moorbounders haven't returned yet from their evening hunt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yarnball!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jannik!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I throw Frumpkin up into the air in vulture form--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The cat?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- to have a look around.

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS, LIAM
lines.text: (meowing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like a large brown, smooth stone with some strange holes in the sides.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where they are? Where the moorbounders are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a shell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From the big turtle!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This appears to be the the long-dried, hollowed corpse shell of one of the horizonback tortoises that has partially fallen and taken back by the plains and was used as a temporary shelter for the evening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so cool.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How do we take that with us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will it fit in the Bag of Holding?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 50 by 50 feet? Yeah, I think so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, big tortoise.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to go to them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, let's go to them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's on the way right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, a little off to the right, but you can swerve over there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We gotta see that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a sight to see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Soon as they see you in the distance catching up and they run up and start getting, you know, rambunctious and excited to see you conscious and moving. What do you do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to going to just calm Clarabelle down and I think I'm going to head over and take a look at the shell, get a better look at this thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think it was probably safe if they were in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to jump around with Yarnball for a while.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's all stay in-- let's all stay in eyesight of each other.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll join them going in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there any holes in the roof?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you climb it like a big jungle gym?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Half-dome?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12, you don't see any like large holes, but the nature of the structure of the shell itself, the hard exoskeleton aspect of it is ridged and easy to climb.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'll climb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you get on top of it, and you can now, if you want to, climb towards the apex of the shell which stands about, I'd say, 30, 25 to 30 feet off the ground, although it's sunken in by five feet, so probably about 20 to 25 feet at its apex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Be careful, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The had this installation last year.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A cool view from up there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there any cracks to see like down into the-- any cracks in the shell or is it all--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you have a unique-- make a perception check from on top of the shell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It resembles a tree, but the size and distance is hard to gauge through the dust and wind that's blowing in with the coming storm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A tree on top of a spire?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The shape of a tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's probably another day's journey to even get there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Good to know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you rolled a 19 on your perception check, so you sort of caught your vision, you're like that's-- you're not sure quite how far it is, but it looks pretty big.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that in the general direction we are heading?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When we go in I would tell Frumpkin to circle like a police helicopter and to cry out if anything-- if he sees anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a perception check for Frumpkin, please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That'd be 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, the rest of you make your way towards the empty interior of the shell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can light it up a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Freshly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They got some orcs, wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fresh enough from the past few hours.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there any clothing left to root through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks to be two handaxes on one of them and the other one had a long sword and a leather shield.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wonder what they were doing out here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks like they're mainly carrying enough things to keep themself alive and to move so-- make a survival check, anybody who would like to try to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a little bit of that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it seems at least your moorbounders went and found some food for the night.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Any other signs of any other people who have maybe camped underneath this thing before? Any disturbed earth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to stare at the moss, I suppose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, yes, it's really soft.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God damn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anything else, any like-- if this has been there for a while, any carvings, any graffiti on the shell anything stand out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not investigation?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a difference between looking about the interior for signs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh that's good, though, 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rudimentary, one of them looks like it's a series of dug-in dots and lines in locations and you gather it almost looks like a simple map of the valley.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does my criminal background clue me in a little bit more that's what it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've seen things like this yeah, and it's usually designed to be a code for people that pass through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What does it look-- is there something that looks like-- could be marked as-- raz, razzes, bazz, ratatatatazan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bazzoxan?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bazzoxan!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The circle seems to be the shell that you're in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is this, what are you looking at?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey Jester, come here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, people try to communicate to each other, smugglers maybe?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take out my sketchbook and I draw it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're not certain what these mean necessarily, but you're just-- you gather the essence of what it was used for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And when that is up, I am going to send Frumpkin very high in the sky, and plant my hand on Beauregard's shoulder and try to look for more of these orcs anywhere on the plains around this place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, okay, Frumpkin is doing so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, no, but-- does it change when I look? Because currently I told Frumpkin he is to look and just squawk if he sees anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a continuation of searching for things in the area.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, well I'll still keep the luck point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At the very least, maybe covering our tracks on the way out might not be a bad idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, good call.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Won't the rain do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But not in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the shell definitely seems to see traffic every now and then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should get moving if we want to keep ahead of--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to slide down the-- slide down the turtle shell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear (sliding)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whee! (impact) Are we going?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, also about a day ahead of us, there's this crazy big thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What kind of big thing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know, it's a big thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like a creature?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, like a big tower or a tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see any of those big, like, things that are gray and have like four eyes and like big arms, like we saw on the other plains?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because me and Yasha saw one of those last night.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Last night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which direction is this tree or tower?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we'll find out soon enough then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you heading towards this shape?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it the same direction we're headed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Loosely. You don't have a specific idea of, you know, a pinpointed radar, but you know you're heading north.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going that way now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's for you guys whoever wants to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we have any sense of where we are on the map?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Within the Fields?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One day's travel from the--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Trying to go up to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So three days--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you're almost to the halfway point. You're roughly at the halfway point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're at that bloodstain right there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel like with Caleb's weird sense of direction and the map they'd have a decent idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not perfect, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you see any towers on the map?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Weird question, do I recognize the weird language that's written on the map?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb deciphered all of those.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's not going to-- nevermind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's so fancy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On we go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's making point on this? I just want to know what the marching order is going forward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take front.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got Caduceus in the front with your moorbounder.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I'm with Caduceus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me and Fjord will be in the middle.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Regulators!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mount up! ♪ It was a clear black night, a clear white moon, ♪ ♪ Warren G was in the streets, carrying to consume. ♪

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb and Nott.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys continue riding forward for the next couple hours, Caduceus, since you are at point, with you and Yasha, if you would both like to make perception checks as you continue forward.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ooh, that's a natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS, SAM, ASHLEY
lines.text: They don't seem to be like becoming a forest of them necessarily, but just less-- less sparse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keeping an eye out for any of those wiley guys we saw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will say Caduceus, you at the front and based on your passive perception, about three and a half to four hours, getting closer to the mid-day, little past noon, you look forward and see another round shape.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it the same approximate size and color of what we were-- what we were used to with the turtle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks a little darker, but at this point you can also see-- the rain hasn't hit you yet, but you can see that gray blanket of distant rain that's now starting to blur the horizon and is making its way in your direction.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We should get shelter.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, there may be another turtle up ahead too and maybe a live one too, I can't quite tell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look, based on-- like there's something related on the map? Shell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This thing's garbage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is the shell moving or is it not moving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about 20 or so feet high now, about 150 feet from you as you glance over and get a better view.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's slow everyone down a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Though it is lying on its side and is not moving.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not moving or not breathing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not moving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think would be a-- wide berth might be a good idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if it can help us? Give us directions?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's a bad idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If it's asleep, we can kill it quite easily.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think if we try to kill it while it was sleeping it might wake up and then it would kill us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It seems to be the smarter thing to do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I would agree. I say we walk around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've been drinking most of the morning, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nott! Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, baby.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you make a perception check in the front.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's better, 17.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, 17.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Open, exposed flesh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eyes of the Grave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The range on that is--?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not far enough away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can get closer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (disapprovingly) Mm! Mm-mm!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go with you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And do I get anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing immediately around you, you're about, let's say 130 feet from them right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could always send in the vulture, although the last time I did that, it keyed those things into our position.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go in. I got this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, Nott, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's very-- let's just maybe get a little-- quietly, get a little closer and see what's happening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't sneak so well when you drink.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm also keeping an eye out for whatever could have done damage to this thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, with the same perception check, still looking around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and get just close enough to see if it's alive, dead, or otherwise, within 60 feet of it, I suppose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so on the moorbounders, slowly you and Yasha are going to-- Your moorbounder goes (growling, sniffing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As he's doing that, we're scanning around, just in case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, I guess make a communal perception check the rest of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Communal perception.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Solid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (growling)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not getting any closer, but I'm not backing out either.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both look at each other and then one goes like-- (snorting) The other one (creaking and snapping)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It occurs to me-- they can understand me. We'll keep moving.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They can understand you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Start to keep moving, see what happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys following suit with Caduceus?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Uh-huh!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Quietly following their lead, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (wings flapping) Looking back over your shoulder, you can see both of them are now taking up and as their wings flap, you can see tendrils of shadow drifting off and then fading a few feet from--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Bless!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're casting Bless on who?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, Caduceus, and Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord, Caduceus, Yasha, you guys have Bless, all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mage Armor on myself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Holding Daylight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Holding Daylight, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And Gift of Alacrity on Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are riding on your moorbounders, Caleb and Beauregard come up nearby and Caleb reaches out and touches your shoulder, and you're infused with the Gift of Alacrity which means for the next eight hours, you get to add a 1d8 to your initiative.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 1d4 to saving throws and attack rolls.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we moving? Is this a moving fight? Is this a car chase?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think we're moving yet--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're moving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think until they start diving.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are taking up the pace.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't want them to know we know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now they're-- as opposed to behind you, they're now behind, they're starting to catch up on the left they're definitely circling around you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're coming up our left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the western side as you guys are traveling northward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there anything coming up on our right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over in that direction, based on the perception you made earlier, you don't see anything else.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What kind of radius are they keeping outside of us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nott rolled a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, don't worry, I know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What kind of distance are they keeping from us in this circle they're making?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're about 100 feet from you right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to rub a bit of fleece and cast Silent Image and make the image of a fourth moorbounder next to us running with us, and with some very nondescript person riding it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so, apparating out of the air, a fourth rider, who's a nondescript person, very plain features, beige clothing, a haircut, riding.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "A haircut." (laughing) Riding a moorbounder.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm thinking a polo shirt, khakis, some loafers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You think we should make this an annoying meal?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think if they move towards us they've made that decision for us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I feel like we should pick up speed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everything here is weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We might be able to outrun them if we go now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to charge up an Eldritch Blast and just follow them just in case they start to break towards us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the right side, Nott, you can see a third one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I knew it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seemingly hearing the screech from the one on the left that was heading the circle and it looks like there are now three of them slowly bearing down on you as you're moving northward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Clever girl.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's pick up the pace.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I smack the back of Jannik's booty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone else catching up as well?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Keep pace, Yarnball!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's not going to be able to catch up with us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: More, more, he's terribly out of shape.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we got 58 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your spell DC?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The spell DC-- oh boy I cast spells sometimes, don't I? Is 15. Oh wow, that's pretty high.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not gaining at the moment, but they're keeping pace to the left.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we being fucking herded?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one behind it, the one behind it splinters off and begins to make its way towards the one that's not keeping up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It lunges down--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Watch out, Chaz, watch out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now you have two that are pincering you from the left and right and behind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it time for Daylight? Just say the word.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Daylight?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far does it reach?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's day time right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, but this is a Daylight spell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it couldn't hurt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, let's crank it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, it is stationary?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No it's not, it can be on an object.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, what are you casting it on?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to cast it on--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My dick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to cast it on the moorbounder that I'm currently riding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one to the back is now on its third strike on your companion before it seems to realize and not give a shit, but it's definitely-- it's fallen behind and because of the pace you guys are going and it's 60 feet behind you, because moorbounders I believe, what's the speed on them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, hold on, let me look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe it's 80 feet, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 40 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 40 feet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Standard speed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but they can jump 30 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thought moorbounder was more than that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that's what it says.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They got little funny notes, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hold on, I have it here somewhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just look right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that is incorrect, they have a speed of 80 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, they're fast creatures.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we fix that in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay, but these creatures can fly 80 feet so literally you guys are going in tandem, but at the speed you're traveling, the one to the back that went after the illusion is not able to get closer to you at this pace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I took out a whole one by myself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pretty good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How long does the Daylight spell last?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm double checking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, one hour.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are keeping about 100 foot distance from you and the Daylight seems to be keeping them at bay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Smart, Caddy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe they'll lose interest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you keep riding.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we attack them at a distance while they're away from us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we can make it even more annoying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got about a hundred, hundred and something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You going to shoot?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would say 20 or 30 and see if they keep up and if they are after us then we can harry them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 20 or 30 seconds?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe they will lose interest if it takes too long.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can the moorbounders go at a full speed for hours and hours, I guess?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Horses can, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take breaks every now and then for time, but a total of eight hours of intense travel for a day is considered possible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know, I'm of the opinion that maybe just spooking them a little bit might be a great idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (powering up and firing) Eldritch Blast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is against what? The one left, behind, or the right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You get a plus four to your attack roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll be like (yelling, firing).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just Gun Kata them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where did those doves come from?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus a d4 to each attack roll because you're blessed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you. Natural one, and the other one is a 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: d4 damage or--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, to your attack roll!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doesn't matter. It hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, whatever.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (mumbled) Eldritch Blast!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 11 points of Eldritch Blast damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one to your right, shrieks as it spins towards you and you can see now it's starting to lean its way closer to try and meet the direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right when he turns to look, I shoot a Guiding Bolt at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the range on Guiding Bolt?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 120 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage-- or roll for attack, sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 17 plus nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 11. 17, thank you.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.text: Okay.

lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine.

lines.text: But overall you guys rolled high enough stealth to avoid its passive perception.

lines.text: And not just in my pants.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It peers forward and looks around, (bird croaking) and withdraws back to the nest and then it goes to rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say it takes the better part of an hour and a half to make it through all these branches quietly around what is-- the perimeter of travel, you guys, to move from the eastern side to that, you're moving I'd say about 200 to 250 feet through very careful, deliberate, quiet movements so it's like, like sloth climbing.

lines.text: Is there any flower up here or fruit?

lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.text: You hungry?

lines.text: I'm in a big ass ancient tree, I don't know, ten.

lines.text: Looking around here, you don't see any fruit or flowers around it, unfortunately.

lines.text: Any roc feathers? Molted off?

lines.text: No.

lines.text: How big is it?

lines.text: The feather is probably about three feet from tip to tip, if not four feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I get to it fairly easily?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try.

lines.text: Four feet from tip to tip?

lines.text: Yeah, I'll try.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a big-ass feather.

lines.text: It's a big-ass bird.

lines.text: You carefully make your way over there, make another stealth check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to keep it, 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You curve around, eventually finding your way to the edge and then grasp. You take the feather, and carefully dislodge it without making a noise and it's a little, you know, tousled on one side, but you have a four-foot roc feather.

lines.text: I don't know, I just wanted it.

lines.text: Bag of holding right here.

lines.text: Burlesque act!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Want to slide that bitch in here? One roc feather.

lines.text: And from this point, looking across the vista, you making your way to the edge, you, too, can see the settlement of Bazzoxan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, there it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you watch an eagle go by holding Nott.

lines.text: (yelling) Bazzoxan is over there.

lines.text: What are you guys doing?

lines.text: Ah yeah, no it hadn't even occurred to me to-- this is really not going to go with what you're wearing at all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I

lines.text: The magic was still there, but there wasn't-- each time you felt like there was a small-scale siphoning of your body temperature, some sort of a shift of that cold ocean.

lines.text: Okay.

lines.text: It's interesting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Huffing and flapping his wings.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, we could also ride on Caleb.

lines.text: There's a big bird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a shifting sound.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck, out of the tree now.

lines.text: Cast that shit.

lines.text: That's two campaigns, Marisha! (laughter)

lines.text: This only like 300 feet.

lines.text: So they're all just falling out of the tree rapidly, the eagle swooping underneath you guys looking up and watch, but just around the way, they've curved around the tree now, quite further than you recall, the rest of your party just plummeting.
